etymology.description: Depicts valley: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth" or open space) in between two mountain walls represented by near-parallel lines -> original form is 𠔌
etymology.interpretation: The character 谷(gǔ, 'valley') visually represents a valley, with an open space flanked by lines resembling mountains. This aligns with its definition as a valley, a feature of the landscape formed by natural geological processes.

examples.chinese: 他走进了幽静的谷(他走進了幽靜的谷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zǒu jìnle yōujìng de gǔ.
examples.english: He walked into the quiet valley.

examples.chinese: 清晨的时候(清晨的時候)，薄雾笼罩着谷(薄霧籠罩著谷)。
examples.pinyin: Qīngchén de shíhòu, bó wù lóngzhào zhe gǔ.
examples.english: In the early morning, a thin mist covered the valley.

examples.chinese: 山谷里回荡着鸟鸣(山谷裡回盪著鳥鳴)。
